availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Charles McKinney (Warren County, Kentucky, physician, farmer, and member of the provisional government)

body.p: Warren County, Kentucky, physician, farmer, postmaster, and member of the provisional government. Married to Mary Catharine Cooke McKinney in Warren County on May 30, 1851. Father of Mary E. McKinney, Samuel A. McKinney, Charles B. McKinney, and Lotty B. McKinney. Postmaster at Smith's Grove, Warren County, from October 11, 1853 to February 26, 1858. Physician in Warren County in 1860. Farmer in Warren County in 1860. Owned six enslaved persons in Warren County in 1860. Member of the convention of the provisional government held at Russellville in November 1861.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Warren County, District 1, p. 820
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Warren County, District 1, p. 44.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Warren County Marriages, Film #000339890, p. 202
Record of Appointment of Postmasters, 1832-1971, NARA Microfilm Publication M841, Records of the Post Office Department, RG 28, Warren County, Kentucky, Volumes 14 and 28, (accessed via Ancestry.com on September 18, 2019), p. pp. 376 and 378 of microfilm.
KYR-0004-033-0001.
